practitioners.name: Guy VOYER
practitioners.background: Creator and founder of ELDOA methodology. Born in Paris. Degrees: Physical Education, Physiotherapy, Sports Medicine, Traumatology, 5 osteopathic programs, PhD Educational Science. Former world champion judo (twenties). Studied at Marseille Faculty of Medicine. One of first to map fascial chains. Developed SomaTraining and SomaTherapy programs.
practitioners.legacy: Created ELDOA in 1977. Only Level 6 Certified ELDOA Expert in France. His wife, Lydie VOYER, has taken over management of the practice.

practitioners.name: Lisa-Marie Farley
practitioners.background: Student of Guy Voyer since 2010. Multiple years manual therapy experience.

practitioners.name: Isabelle Dauliach
practitioners.notable: Founded Chamango studio with multiple ELDOA-trained instructors

practitioners.name: Sandrine Kinard-Tessier
practitioners.yearsExperience: 25+ years movement therapy, 10+ years functional rehab

practitioners.name: Laura Adams
practitioners.background: Certified Studio Du Corps. Pilates & Yoga Moms Instructor. Assisting Program Director at Beach Fitness. Mother of two, passionate about body education.
practitioners.address: 148 Main St Suite F, Seal Beach, CA 90740

practitioners.name: Lester Cruz
practitioners.background: Director of Personal Training at Beach Fitness. Perpetual continuing education focus.
practitioners.address: 148 Main St Suite F, Seal Beach, CA 90740

practitioners.name: Matthew Serrano
practitioners.background: Licensed Massage Therapist. Exercise specialist at ELDOAUSA. Mountain biking enthusiast.
practitioners.address: 148 Main St Suite F, Seal Beach, CA 90740

practitioners.name: Antoinette De La Espriella
practitioners.background: Group Fitness Instructor. Southern California native. Volleyball coach at Millikan High School. Traveled to 13 countries. Also works in real estate.
practitioners.address: 148 Main St Suite F, Seal Beach, CA 90740

practitioners.name: Nate Pok (Nickita)
practitioners.background: Trainer at Beach Fitness, part of world-class facility team.
practitioners.address: 148 Main St Suite F, Seal Beach, CA 90740

practitioners.name: Fumiaki Isshiki
practitioners.education: DPT Loma Linda University (2012), Bachelor's PT Kobegakuin (Japan)
practitioners.background: Born/raised Japan, former Pilates instructor, played baseball, worked with Japanese pro baseball team. Founded Global Doctor of Physical Therapy.
practitioners.address: 148 Main St Suite 1110, Seal Beach, CA 90740

practitioners.name: Pete Dack
practitioners.background: Owner/operator Tensegrity Fitness Training in Santa Monica.

practitioners.name: Pamela Maloney
practitioners.education: PhD, Doctor Homeopathic Medicine, Licensed Acupuncturist, Emperor's College (MTOM), Logan College
practitioners.background: Published author of 4 books including 'Fascia Cosmetic Acupuncture™.' Taught Connective Tissue Cadaver Dissection at Pepperdine (8 years). Agape Choir member (performed with John Legend at DNC).
practitioners.notableClients: A-List celebrities and industry notables. Featured in Self magazine, cable TV show.

practitioners.name: Wendy Shubin
practitioners.education: MSPAS Arcadia University (1999-2001), 1000+ hour yoga therapy training
practitioners.background: PA at HRC Fertility. Sustained traumatic neck injury causing 4.5 years chronic headaches/vertigo - credits full recovery to osteopathy, yoga therapy, ELDOA. Studies with Dr. Guy Voyer, Bryce Turner, Brent Meier. Co-Founder OC Positive Posture.
practitioners.notableClients: Featured speaker Fertility Summit. 100+ ON-DEMAND classes, LIVE Zoom Wed 6pm

practitioners.name: Andrew Hauser
practitioners.education: BS Athletic Training (Kansas, 2008), MS Performance Psychology (2020)
practitioners.background: Director of Performance Rehab LA Dodgers (2020 World Series championship). Director Player Health & Performance Atlanta Braves. Now private practice Continuum High Performance (Phoenix).
practitioners.notableClients: LA Dodgers (2020 World Series), Atlanta Braves. Developed comprehensive RTP models for MLB. Featured in sports science podcasts.

practitioners.name: Roy Page
practitioners.education: DC Logan College (MS Sports Science & Rehab), Emperor's College (MTOM)
practitioners.background: Head Associate with Dr. Craig Liebenson since 2012. Studied Yang Taijiquan since 1997 after severe football injury left him wheelchair-bound for year - Taijiquan major component teaching him to walk again. Studied with Dr. Yang Jwing-Ming and Grandmaster Kao Tao. Co-taught martial arts at Rhodes College (2001-2006).
practitioners.notable: Past secretary International Society Clinical Rehabilitation Specialists

practitioners.name: Maxwell Karish
practitioners.education: Santa Monica College, 900+ hours National Holistic Institute
practitioners.background: Personal experience with soft tissue injuries led to discovering lasting results through specific exercise, manual therapy, lifestyle modifications. Currently Year 3 of Guy Voyer's 3-year SomaTraining program.
practitioners.notableClients: Professional athletes, weekend warriors, post-surgery rehabilitation

practitioners.name: Stephen Howell
practitioners.background: Listed in official ELDOA directory.

practitioners.name: Tara Lyn Emerson
practitioners.background: California native, daughter of pro tennis coach. Diagnosed with Charcot Marie Tooth disease (degenerative neuromuscular) as child - despite genetic condition, became strongest ever. Voted one of LA's Best Cycling Instructors by ClassPass.
practitioners.notableClients: Featured trainer: Popsugar Fitness, iFit by NordicTrack, TRX Training Club, FabFitFun. Equinox instructor. 174K+ Instagram followers. ELDOA helped her grow 1.25 inches taller.

practitioners.name: Teal Montgomery
practitioners.background: Listed in official ELDOA directory.

practitioners.name: Roy Khoury
practitioners.background: Started in PT clinic while completing studies. Opened specialized golf fitness studio Newport Beach 2014. Teaching ELDOA since 2012 after first course with Dr. Guy Voyer.
practitioners.notableClients: Pro golfers, golf trainers, student athletes, weekend warriors. Named one of Best Trainers by industry professionals.

practitioners.name: Marcia Dixon
practitioners.background: Background in art, not naturally athletic. Found Contrology helped knee issues. Completed ELDOA trainer certification to enhance practice.

practitioners.name: Jonathan Pierce
practitioners.background: Elite distance runner, competed 2008 US Olympic Team Trials. Professional distance runner 2007-2011. Consultant for Brooks (managing pro track athletes), Director Rehab, Sports Therapy Consultant SD Chargers (2013), Elite athlete therapy Rock n Roll SD Marathon (2013-2015), USOC Massage Therapist track & field (2010-2012).
practitioners.notableClients: Olympic gold medalists, professional athletes, Marathon runners, triathletes, CrossFit, weightlifters, track & field. 75-year-old retirees to Olympic medalists.

practitioners.name: Jeffrey Lacson
practitioners.background: Practitioner at Kinetik Performance with Jonathan Pierce's team.

practitioners.name: Rex Butler
practitioners.background: Trained with renowned experts including Dr. Guy Voyer. Deeply rooted in Osteopathic Medicine. Treats patients exclusively with hands-on manual techniques. Based on complex systems theory model which is non-linear, focuses on body as whole.

practitioners.name: Andrew Flores
specializations: Unconventional strength (clubbell, steel mace, kettlebells, sandbags)
practitioners.background: Southern California native. Specializes in mobility training and unconventional strength training for all levels.
practitioners.notableClients: All athletes, martial artists, dancers, first responders, elderly. Regular workshops: mobility/flexibility, kettlebell, Acro Yoga, Animal Flow.

practitioners.name: Travis McKay
practitioners.background: Played basketball through college, follows sports avidly (USC fan). Severe foot injury led to PT passion. Noticed difficulty patients had maintaining progress after dismissal, led to developing TherEx Station.
practitioners.notable: Known for individualized attention, improving balance/stability, preventing falls, helping mobility after injuries. Max 6 people per class.

practitioners.name: Matthew Black
practitioners.background: House of Hustle, Redwood City specialized in personal training and small group metabolic circuit training.
practitioners.note: House of Hustle appears closed as of research date.

practitioners.name: Justin Brink
practitioners.education: Palmer College West (Magna Cum Laude, 2011), BS Biology CSU Sacramento
practitioners.background: Clinic Director at Premiere Spine & Sport San Jose 12+ years before relocating to Eagle, Idaho. Internship Ultimate Sports Medicine SF under Dr. Lenny Stein (treated Golden State Warriors, SF Ballet, Olympic athletes). Instructor RockTape Inc (2009-present), Adjunct Professor De Anza College (2008-present). Not traditional 'snap/crack' - holistic approach.
practitioners.notableClients: NHL players: Lukas Radil, Teemu Selänne, Joe Thornton, Patrick Marleau, Joe Pavelski. UFC: Luke Rockhold, Josh Barnett, Phil Baroni. Worked at Cisco LifeConnections 10+ years.

practitioners.name: Jeffrey Chenault
practitioners.background: Red Dot Fitness located heart of San Jose near Whole Foods on The Alameda. State-of-the-art facility accessible to major South Bay communities. 'Fitness from the inside out' philosophy.
practitioners.notable: Yelp 4.4 stars (67+ reviews). 21K Instagram followers. Free consultations. Multiple online programs: TBSC, Fit for Action, Physique, Burn, Mobility, RDF On The Go.

practitioners.name: Brian DeGarmo
practitioners.background: SOL Physical Therapy + Performance leading East Bay PT practice for 20+ years. Part of Alliance Physical Therapy Partners network. Two locations same address (Suite 103 Performance, Suite 201 PT).
practitioners.notable: Yelp 5 stars (145+ reviews). Known for sophisticated diagnostic tools, evidence-based science. Testimonial: 'Through two knee surgeries, hip replacement, shoulder surgery - SOL been there 15 years.'

practitioners.name: Rodrigo Fernandez
practitioners.background: Movement specialist grew up in Mexico as curious/playful kid. Bridges intentional training with playful movement. Philosophy: 'I've never heard anyone say they hate having fun.' Challenges 'no pain, no gain' mentality. Sought out top teachers to become competent in all forms of health/movement.

practitioners.name: Jaron Hua
practitioners.education: Life Chiropractic College West, Brown University (Neuroscience & Biology), L'Académie Sutherland d'Ostéopathie du Québec (DO Candidate)
practitioners.background: Multiple childhood concussions and MVAs left him sick for years. 2014 lumbar disc herniation - ELDOA helped recover. After first appointment with Dr. Guy Voyer: 'felt like I had a second chance in my body.'
practitioners.note: Currently NOT accepting new patients (as of late update). Message for further help.

practitioners.name: Joe McVeigh
practitioners.background: Listed in official ELDOA directory. Limited public information available.

practitioners.name: Mike Salemi
practitioners.background: Started strength & conditioning age 15 as competitive powerlifter. WABDL World Champion Bench Press & Deadlift at 19. Former D1 collegiate S&C coach Santa Clara University. 15+ years competing elite level Powerlifting and Kettlebell Sport. Former WAKSC Long Cycle World Champion. Studied extensively with Paul Chek.
practitioners.notable: Professional Kettlebell Sport (double 32kg/40kg). International presenter. Featured podcasts: Ben Greenfield Fitness, The Bledso Show, Just Fly Sports, Strong Coach, Cycle in Alignment. Costa Rica retreats.

practitioners.name: Tyler Ferrell
practitioners.education: Towson University BS Marketing/E-Business (Summa Cum Laude), 2 years NCAA D1 golf
practitioners.background: ONLY person named to BOTH Golf Digest 'Best Young Teachers' AND 'Best Golf Fitness Professionals.' Founded Golf Smart Academy (1100+ videos). Presented World Golf Fitness Summit (2016), TPI Summit (2024). Author 'The Stock Tour Swing.'
practitioners.notableClients: Charles Howell III (PGA Tour Winner), consulted top coaches/pro players. Dr. Greg Rose (TPI): 'one of the best in the business.' 2024 TPI presentation: 'Tactical Coaching: Sensing/Guiding Golf Swing Body Movements.'

practitioners.name: Kevin A. Cruz
practitioners.education: University of Houston Wolff Center Entrepreneurship (Top program in country)
practitioners.background: Born Tocoa, Honduras; immigrated US age 11. Struggled with undiagnosed ADHD, language barriers - took 7 years to complete college. Founded multiple tech companies (InTuneTo, ParqU, Imalysis, Coconect) before focusing full-time on ELDOA/wellness. Trained directly under Dr. Guy Voyer.
practitioners.notable: 2nd Place Winner Baker Ripley Business Plan Competition (Jan 2019) - used funds to create Soma Athletic Wellness. Featured in Voyage Houston Magazine. Grand Prize Winner 'California Dreamin'' Business Plan.
practitioners.notableClients: Dancers, professional athletes, chronic pain/recurring injury sufferers.

practitioners.name: Denise Herrera
practitioners.background: Started career as professional dancer. Discovered Pilates, began teaching at Desert Mountain Club (private golf community). Noticed many clients with spinal issues. Certified through TPI Golf Fitness, CHEK Institute's Golf Biomechanics/Holistic Lifestyle. Trained under Dr. Guy Voyer and Scott Herrera at Legacy Sports Performance. Success story: helped 25-year chronic back pain sufferer (post-surgical complications) return to golf virtually pain-free.
practitioners.notableClients: Desert Mountain Club members (private golf community). 'At SomaWorks, we are your coach—not your crutch.'

practitioners.name: Kacey A. Grissom
practitioners.background: Listed in official ELDOA directory. Limited public biographical information available.

practitioners.name: Deva Lingemann
practitioners.background: Accomplished ultrarunner with 14 race results in UltraRunning Magazine database. Competed in multiple 50K, 50-mile, 100-mile, and 12-hour races. Performance highlights include 100-mile race completion (25:57:12 at Lake Cuyamaca). Based in Cave Creek area.
practitioners.notable: Ultrarunning achievements: 2012 Cave Creek 50K 12th overall/2nd female (5:36:35), 2010 Lake Cuyamaca 100 Miles 38th overall/14th female (25:57:12), multiple ultra races 2010-2012.

practitioners.name: Jimmy Yuan
practitioners.education: DC New York Chiropractic College (2001), BS Psychobiology SUNY Binghamton, Fellowship Medical Acupuncture
practitioners.background: Moved to Phoenix Jan 8, 2002. Founded Warrior Restoration 2010. Born/raised Queens, NY. Age 41 as of 2018. Personal fitness: kettlebells, taekwondo. Lectures nationwide on functional movement assessments.
practitioners.notableClients: Professional athletes: Bertrand Berry (#92 AZ Cardinals), Karlos Dansby (Football), Cole Hamels, Dontrelle Willis (Baseball), Marcus Morris, Grant Hill (Basketball), Daniel Bryan, Brie Bella (WWE), Ludacris, Jon Rahm (PGA Tour), ASU Women's Golf Team. Consultant: Atlanta Braves, Washington Nationals, Dallas Stars, LA Dodgers, Washington Capitals. Featured Phoenix Magazine Feb 2018.

practitioners.name: Timothy Pierce
specializations: Pain management as alternative to surgery
practitioners.background: Founded Pierce Family Wellness to provide holistic wellness solutions converging multiple disciplines. Takes holistic approach to fitness focusing on reducing pain, improving performance, increasing longevity.
practitioners.notable: Emphasis on 'out of pain, into performance and longevity' through integrated massage therapy and exercise. Offers online and in-person options.

practitioners.name: Dana Rodriguez
practitioners.education: B.F.A. Performing Arts Management Brooklyn College, B.A. Dance University of South Florida, Pilates Certificate Kane School Core Integration
practitioners.background: Former professional dancer, choreographer/teacher Monroe Dance Academy. After severe back/neck issues led to spine surgery, discovered ELDOA and became pain-free within weeks. This transformation inspired her to help others. Board member Martha Graham Center Contemporary Dance, Committee Member CT State Dept of Education.
practitioners.notable: Instructor Freedom Road Pilates (Spring 2006+). Combines Pilates and ELDOA recognizing they complement perfectly. Clients report feeling taller, stronger, more flexible with sustainable results.

practitioners.name: Ian Ryan
practitioners.background: Listed in official ELDOA directory. Limited public information available.

practitioners.name: Talita Moss
specializations: Yoga for children with special needs ('Soothing Yoga' ages 8-12)
practitioners.background: Brazilian native. Discovered passion for teaching after enrolling in teacher training to deepen own practice. Teaching venues: Darien YMCA, Darien Library, private sessions. Decade of experience teaching people of all abilities/ages.
practitioners.notable: Pioneered 'Soothing Yoga' for special needs children at Darien YMCA. Featured in Darien Daily Voice (multiple articles 2015-2016). NIKE Sports Camps instructor. ELDOA workshops targeting spine, shoulders, hips, ribcage, pelvis. Focuses on clear alignment, creating space through breath.

practitioners.name: Emily Morgan
specializations: H.A.N.G.A.R. approach (Holistic Approach to Nutrition, Growth, Activity, Restoration)
Six Foundation Principles: exercise, recovery, nutrition, breathing, hydration, mindset
practitioners.background: Former high-level soccer player and professional women's tackle football athlete. Suffered chronic hip pain 14 years that went undiagnosed despite numerous medical consultations, leading to unnecessary hernia surgery. Discovered ELDOA Summer 2017, became pain-free within weeks. Made it her mission to help others. Has scoliosis, multiple head traumas from sports.
practitioners.notable: Featured in POPSUGAR fitness article about ELDOA method. Featured in Integra Healthcare blog. Personal story used as case study for ELDOA effectiveness. Philosophy: '90% of all diseases caused by mismanagement of diet/lifestyle factors.'

practitioners.name: Andrew Johnston
specializations: Private personal training with extensive (2-hour) physical assessment
practitioners.background: 1992: Invited as resident athlete Olympic Training Center Colorado Springs. 1994: Turned pro cyclist (Belgian Haverbeke GB team). 1996: Competed Olympic Trials. 1996-1998: Raced professionally Spain. 1999: Cycling career ended due to crash/third concussion. 2001: Olympic Distance Champion of Georgia (triathlon), All-American, U.S. World Triathlon team. 2006: First Leukemia Survivor to qualify for/finish Hawaii Ironman World Championships. 2012: Qualified 70.3 World Championships. 2012: Overall Win Great Floridian - First Leukemia Survivor to win Iron Distance Triathlon. 2014: 3rd place Race Across America (3000 miles) - raised $250K+ for Leukemia & Lymphoma Society.
practitioners.notable: Men's Journal 'Best Trainers in the U.S.' 2005 and 2009. Corrective Health Exercise Kinesiologist Georgia (2001). Subject of award-winning documentary 'Living Is Winning' (2006). Featured Voyage ATL Magazine, Shape Atlanta. Published author: 'Holistic Strength Training for Triathlon' (AuthorHouse) + second book. Corporate clients: Google, Procter & Gamble. ~90% new clients from word of mouth.
practitioners.notableClients: Corporate clients, post-cancer survivors, Olympic distance triathletes, endurance athletes

practitioners.name: Christin/Christina Zimmerman
practitioners.background: Owner/founder ELDOA Savannah. Committed to educating clients about their bodies and bringing Dr. Guy Voyer's unique methods to Savannah. Member Savannah Chamber of Commerce (joined Sept 2024). Season 5 Sponsor 'Made of Savannah' podcast. Featured guest on 'Made of Savannah' podcast episode 'Postures and Passion: Enter the World of ELDOA Savannah.' Active social media with regular class updates.
practitioners.notable: Emphasizes work is 'not merely a workout or typical fitness class' but 'movement improvement program' where clients 'up-level movement skills.' Helps clients read body's story, move beyond limiting narratives. Clients report improvements in strength, balance, mobility, core strength, pelvis (postpartum), injury recovery.

practitioners.name: Linda Danner
practitioners.education: PhD (field unspecified), 15 years classical ballet training
practitioners.background: 15 years classical ballet training, performed professionally with New York Dance Theatre under Frank Ohman (NYC Ballet). Completed Ashtanga Yoga Teacher Training with Tim Miller twice. Studied at Ashtanga Yoga Research Institute, Mysore, India (two trips). After major spinal injury 2011 leaving her unable to sit/stand/walk, underwent major surgery. Discovered powerful rehabilitation tool of Soma exercise. Inspired by own recovery while mothering two young boys, dedicated herself to helping others. Studying directly with Guy Voyer, D.O. since 2013 (12+ years).
practitioners.notable: Classes: General Spine Health/Postural Awareness, Lower Back & Pelvis, Mid-Back & Shoulders, Neck/Arms/Shoulders. Philosophy: 'You are your own best therapist' (Guy Voyer). Clients report immediate results, increased mobility, freedom of movement, body balance, ease of muscle tension, increased energy/performance. Active in Eastern Sierra: backpacking, rock climbing, cross-country skiing.

practitioners.name: Andrew Anderson
practitioners.yearsExperience: 15+ years rehab/fitness profession, 35+ years health/fitness lifestyle
practitioners.background: Transitioned from successful restaurant/hospitality career. 2006: Became partner in boutique manual PT practice where he trained/certified in multiple advanced therapies. Discovered true calling: helping people get better. Established Enso Health and Fitness, Inc. 2018 'based on principle that ALL aspects of health/fitness influence and related to each other.' Committed to lifelong learning, constantly searches for newest information/most effective methods. Avid martial artist (35+ years), weight lifter (35+ years), Spartan athlete.
practitioners.notable: Partnership with Charles Koch combining ELDOA, SomaTherapy, MAT, yoga, tai chi, personal training. Clients report significant pain reduction (chronic back, nighttime hip), avoided surgery, improved flexibility/strength, better balance/reduced injury, increased golf performance (10-15 yards farther), weight loss (40+ lbs), improved quality of life. Testimonials: 'Excellent therapist,' 'most experienced/knowledgeable practitioner,' 'last-ditch effort' that successfully avoided surgery.
practitioners.notableClients: Chronic pain sufferers, post-surgery patients, golfers, general fitness clients
